concept.definition: A collection of terms and their definitions using within a business context.
A W3C standard for representing business vocabularies, controlled vocabularies, taxonomies and thesauri.
A scheme of classification of items usually in a hierarchial structure where broader terms are higher in a tree structure.
Lists of words in groups of synonyms and related concepts.

A formal naming and definition of the types, properties, and interrelationships of the entities that really or fundamentally exist for a particular domain of discourse. Ontologies frequently contain rules that govern taxonomies.
A classification of six database architectures that include relational, analytical, key-value, column-family, graph and document databases.
A database management system is software application that manages collections of data in a consistent way.
A document-oriented database, or document store, is a database architecture designed for storing, retrieving, and managing document-oriented information, also known as semi-structured data.
